definition: to respond to a poem with a poem
to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to thank with a gift
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
to reminisce
variant of 酬[chou2]
to exchange toasts
song/chant/rhythmic declamation
quatrain (poetic form)
ink slab and sitting mat/place where one studies and teaches
to recite poetry
emotions expressed in writing
erotic verse
gratitude for good treatment/to sigh/to lament
women's love/passion (felt by lady)
to recite/to sing (of poetry)
reply to a poem in the same rhyme
